intro: Cassinia leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptation to dry environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Cassinia leptophylla is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
